title: Keeping the House Absent, Johnson Marginalizes Congress and Himself
summary: The speaker’s decision to hold the House in an indefinite hiatus during the shutdown is his latest move to diminish the role of the legislative branch — and his own post.

summary: The federal indictment of New York’s attorney general centers on a home she purchased for a relative. It is an act that rings deeply familiar to many.

summary: The inordinate gilded privilege of being a member of the royal family takes anything but the strongest character and ruins all the good in it.

title: Personal History

title: Trump’s Russia Sanctions Shift War Dynamics to the Energy Front

title: Why a Chef in Brazil Couldn’t Stomach a Menu Request for a Prince’s Event
